member.name: M:FullMotion.LiveForSpeed.InSim.IInSimRelayHandler.SetGridOrder(System.Byte[])
member.summary: You can send the grid order LFS before a race start, to specify the starting order. It may be a good idea to avoid conflict by using /start=fixed (LFS setting). Alternatively, you can leave the LFS setting, but make sure you send your order AFTER you receive the VoteAction. LFS does its default grid reordering at the same time as it sends the VoteAction and you can override this by sending your grid order.

member.name: M:FullMotion.LiveForSpeed.InSim.InSimHandler.SetGridOrder(System.Byte[])
member.summary: You can send the grid order LFS before a race start, to specify the starting order. It may be a good idea to avoid conflict by using /start=fixed (LFS setting). Alternatively, you can leave the LFS setting, but make sure you send your order AFTER you receive the VoteAction. LFS does its default grid reordering at the same time as it sends the VoteAction and you can override this by sending your grid order.

member.name: T:FullMotion.LiveForSpeed.InSim.ConfigurationHandler
member.summary:
ConfigurationHandler is never directly invoked. It is however required for registering your Configuration Xml fragment in app.config or web.config. To register the xml fragment of <lfsinsim/>, add the following to your configuration, followed by the actual config:
<configSections> <section name="lfsinsim" type="FullMotion.LiveForSpeed.InSim.ConfigurationHandler,LFSLib" /> </configSections>
